REVIEW OF SYSTEMS : PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : The physical examination was unremarkable . Pulses were 2+ and symmetrical throughout bilaterally without bruits . HOSPITAL COURSE : His operative course was unremarkable and postoperatively , he did well until he developed some constipation and abdominal distention several days postoperatively . He then developed massive dilatation of the cecum which was treated with multiple endoscopies and rectal tube placement . Despite these efforts and despite the lack of physical signs , on the day of the operation , he experienced a popping sensation in his abdomen while he was walking and then the onset of mild diffuse abdominal pain . The patient was therefore brought to the Operating Room where he was found to have a perforated sigmoid colon with gross soilage of the peritoneal cavity . He was further found to have what appeared to be an area of diverticulitis with abscess formation in his sigmoid colon . He therefore underwent a subtotal colectomy with Hartman pouch creation and ileostomy creation . The patient continued to improve postoperatively and had essentially an unremarkable course with the exception that his creatinine became elevated . The patient was discharged home in stable condition and will follow up with the clinic . He ruled out for myocardial infarction .
